poem:
### The Search for Pseudotrichia

Beneath driftwood shadows,  
hairy travelers roam—  
tiny exiles from the Rhine.  
In fractured Thames whispers,  
they cling to patches of time,  
lost pilgrims of the tide,  
shell-bound secrets seeking  
a fleeting sunlit home.  
London's cobbled embrace  
holds the hidden curl  
of Germany's gentle breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Search is on for the German hairy snail in London It is tiny, hairy and “German” – and it could be hiding underneath a piece of driftwood near you. Citizen scientists and expert conchologists are teaming up to conduct the first London-wide search for one of Britain’s most endangered molluscs. The fingernail-sized German hairy snail (Pseudotrichia rubiginosa) is found in fragmented patches of habitat mostly along the tidal Thames. It was not recorded in Britain". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

The fingernail-sized German hairy snail (Pseudotrichia rubiginosa) is found in fragmented patches of habitat mostly along the tidal Thames. It was not recorded in Britain
